item.title: Academic
item.description: The highly flexible website framework for Hugo with an extensible plugin mechanism. Create a beautifully simple site in under 10 minutes ðŸš€ Latest release (function defer() { if (window.jQuery) { jQuery(document).ready(function(){ GetLatestReleaseInfo(); }); } else { setTimeout(function() { defer() }, 50); } })(); function GetLatestReleaseInfo() { $.getJSON('https://api.github.com/repos/gcushen/hugo-academic/tags').done(function (json) { let release = json[0]; // let downloadURL = release.zipball_url; $('#academic-release').text('Latest release ' + release.name); }); }

About me I am an instructor in the Department of Plant Pathology at Kansas State University, Manhattan, KS. I teach Principles of Plant Pathology (PLPTH 500) that is offered every spring semester. This is a fundamental course in plant pathology that introduces students to nature of plant pathogens and to cause, effect, and management of plant diseases. I also coordinate undergraduate minor in plant pathology. I am a plant disease epidemiologist by training.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Teaching credentials Current instructional activities Principles of plant pathology (PLPTH 500) at Kansas State University (offered every spring semester). Lab teaching of Crop Diseases (PLPTH 585) with Judy O’Mara (offered every fall semester). Developing an Introduction to R workshop with Dr. Sydney Everhart. co-taught with Sydney Everhart and Nikita Gambhir at University of Nebraska, Lincoln on March 11th, 2019. taught with Daljit Singh at Kansas State University, Manhattan on June 27th, 2019.

item.title: Resources
item.description: Plant Pathology CSI Tree - investigating plant pathogens Statistics Data Organization in Spreadsheets by Karl Broman and Kara Woo. Data wrangling, exploration, and analysis with R by Jenny Bryan. Hands-On Programming with R by Garrett Grolemund.
